Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: An transaction instance must contain an identifier. The identifier enables positive referencing the document instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Carrier Assigned ID
Element.Description: The ID assigned by the carrier party

Element.Name: Dispatch advice issue date
Element.Description: The date when this version of the Waybill is issued. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD".

Element.Name: Dispatch advice issue time
Element.Description: The time when this version of the Waybill is issued. Format = "hh:mm:ss".

Element.Name: Waybill type
Element.Description: The name (kind of Waybill) of Waybill type. Use "CMR" for CMR, "Bill of Laden" for Bill of laden, "Air Waybill" for Air Waybill or CIM for Train Waybill.

Element.Name: Shipping Order ID
Element.Description: An identifier (in the form of a reference number) of the Shipping Order or Forwarding Instruction associated with this shipment.

Element.Name: Consignor Party
Element.Description: The party sending the goods in the Waybill, often the issuer of the Waybill.

Element.Name: Endpoint ID
Element.Description: An identifier for the end point of the routing service for the Consignor party (e.g., EAN Location Number, GLN).

Element.Name: Consignor identification
Element.Description: An identifier for the consignor party.

Element.Name: ID
Element.Description: The ID used for identification.

Element.Name: Consignor party name
Element.Description: The name of the consignor party.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: The postal address of the consignor party.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country
Element.Description: The country of the address

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Consignor party name
Element.Description: The name of the consignor party.

Element.Name: Consignor parties legal registration name
Element.Description: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the consignor legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Country
Element.Description: The residens country for the consignor party.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Contact
Element.Description: The contact of the consignor party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Carrier party
Element.Description: The carrier party responsible for this Waybill.

Element.Name: Endpoint ID
Element.Description: An identifier for the end point of the routing service for the carrier party (e.g., EAN Location Number, GLN).

Element.Name: Carrier party identification
Element.Description: An identifier for the Carrier party.

Element.Name: Carrier party name
Element.Description: The name of the carrier party.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: The postal address of the carrier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: The registration name of the carrier party
Element.Description: The registration name of the carrier party.

Element.Name: Carrier parties legal registration name
Element.Description: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the carrier legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Country
Element.Description: The residens country for the carrier party.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Contact
Element.Description: The contact of the Carrier party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Contact email telephone
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Person
Element.Description: The driver or master person for the carrier party.

Element.Name: Identity Document Reference
Element.Description: Reference to an identity of the driver or master person.

Element.Name: ID
Element.Description: The ID of identity the person for instance a driver license number.

Element.Name: Document Type
Element.Description: The type of identity for instance a driver license.

Element.Name: Freight Forwarder party
Element.Description: The party responsible for organizing the shipment, often known as the integrator

Element.Name: Freight Forwarder party identification
Element.Description: An identifier for the Freight Forwarder party.

Element.Name: Freight forwarder party name
Element.Description: The name of the freight forwarder party.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: The postal address of the freight forwarder.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Freight forwarder party name
Element.Description: The name of the freight forwarder party.

Element.Name: Freight forwarders parties legal registration name
Element.Description: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the freight forwarders legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Country
Element.Description: The residens country for the carrier party.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Contact
Element.Description: The contact of the freight forwareder party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Shipping Order ID
Element.Description: A contractual arrangement whereby an identifiable collection of goods items is to be transported from one party (usually a Supplier) to another party (usually a Customer)

Element.Name: Shipment identifier
Element.Description: Identifies a shipment. Freight forwarders reference number. If this ID is in the GSIN format, it should be indicated in the attribute @schemeID.

Attribute.Description: Used to indicate that the ID is in the GSIN format. The Global Shipment Identification Number (GSIN) is a number that identifies a shipment and is assigned by the seller of goods. The goods shipper collects one or more logistic units for transportation to a recipient. A GSIN is assigned to this group of logistic units to identify them as a shipment.

Element.Name: Shipment description
Element.Description: Free-form text pertinent to this shipment, conveying information that is not contained explicitly in other structures.

Element.Name: Consignment information
Element.Description: An identifiable collection of goods items sent from one party (the Despatch Party) to another party (the Consignee) via one or more modes of transport.

Element.Name: Consignment identifier
Element.Description: If this ID is in the GINC format, it should be indicated in the attribute @schemeID.

Attribute.Description: Used to indicate that the ID is in the GINC (Global Identification Number for Consignment) format. This number identifies a consignment, which is a logical grouping of goods (one or more logistics units) transferred to a freight forwarder to be transported for a specific journey. The consignment number must be allocated by a freight forwarder (or a carrier acting as a freight forwarder) or a consignor, but only if prior agreement of the freight forwarder is given.

Element.Name: Consignee Consignment identifier
Element.Description: Consignment identifier assigned by the consignee

Element.Name: Consignor Consignment identifier
Element.Description: Consignment identifier assigned by the consignor

Element.Name: Consignment gross weight
Element.Description: The gross weight of the consignment as a whole. Must be equal the sum of the gross weight specified for the included transport handling unites if this is specified. Mandatory if grossvolumen or loading lenght is not specified

Element.Name: Consignment gross volume
Element.Description: The gross volumen of the consignment. Must be greather or equal the the volumen specified for the included transport handling unites if this is specified. Mandatory if grosswaight or loading lenght is not specified.

Element.Name: Loading length measure
Element.Description: The total length in a means of transport or a piece of transport equipment which, given the width and height of the transport means, will accommodate all of the consignments in a single consolidation. Mandatory if grossweight or grossvolumen is not specified

Element.Name: Hazardous risk indicator
Element.Description: An indication that the transported goods in this consignment are subject to an international regulation concerning the carriage of dangerous goods (true) or not (false).

Element.Name: Total number of transport handling units
Element.Description: The total numbers of transport handling units is this consignment

Element.Name: Delivery party
Element.Description: The party responsible for receiving the goods in the Waybill.

Element.Name: Consignee party identification
Element.Description: An identifier for the consignee party.

Element.Name: Delivery party name
Element.Description: The name of the consignee party.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: The postal address of the Consignee

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Party legal entity.
Element.Description: Information about the legal entity for the consignee party.

Element.Name: Consignee or delivery party name
Element.Description: The legal name of the consignee party.

Element.Name: Consignee or delivery parties legal registration id
Element.Description: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the consignee parties legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Country
Element.Description: The residens country for the consignee party.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Contact
Element.Description: The contact of the delivery party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Original departure country
Element.Description: The country from which the goods in this consignment were originally exported, without any commercial transaction taking place in intermediate countries.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Final destination country
Element.Description: The country in which the goods in this consignment are to be delivered to the final consignee or buyer.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Payment terms
Element.Description: The terms of payment between the parties (such as logistics service client, logistics service provider) in a transaction.

Element.Name: Payment terms identification
Element.Description: An identifier for this set of payment terms.

Element.Name: Payment terms note
Element.Description: A free text describing this set of payment terms.

Element.Name: Transport handling unit
Element.Description: Used to specify the outer most packages, the units that the transporters deals with.

Element.Name: Identifier transport handling unit
Element.Description: The SSCC identification code of this Transport Handling Unit.

Element.Name: Handling unit type code
Element.Description: Type of Transport Handling Unit. Use UN/ECE Recommendation 21 with addition of the codes used by "Retursystem Byggpall".

Element.Name: Handling Code
Element.Description: The handling for this transporthandling unit expressed as a code

Element.Name: Handling instructions
Element.Description: The handling for this transporthandling unit expressed as a text

Element.Name: Handling unit hazardous indicator
Element.Description: An indicator that the materials contained in this transport handling unit are subject to an international regulation concerning the carriage of dangerous goods (true) or not (false).

Element.Name: Shipping marks
Element.Description: Free-form description of the marks and numbers on this transport handling unit.

Element.Name: Transport equipment
Element.Description: Used to specify Transport Equipment details associated with this Transport Handling Unit.

Element.Name: Identifier transport equipment
Element.Description: An id for the physical transport equipment e.g. a container number.

Element.Name: Tranport equipment type code
Element.Description: An code specifying the type of equipment.

Element.Name: Size type code
Element.Description: A code signifying the size and type of this piece of piece of transport equipment. When the piece of transport equipment is a shipping container, it is recommended to use ContainerSizeTypeCode for validation.

Element.Name: Indicator refrigeration transport equipment
Element.Description: An indicator that this piece of transport equipments refrigeration is on (true) or off (false).

Element.Name: Description transport equipment
Element.Description: A textual description of the transport equipment.
Element.Value: A 20 foot refrigerated container that is not actively controlling temperature of the product.

Element.Name: Power indicator transport equipment
Element.Description: An indicator that this piece of transport equipment can supply power (true) or not (false).

Element.Name: Measurement dimension
Element.Description: Used to specify any measurement of the Transport Handling Unit.

Element.Name: Attribute identifier
Element.Description: To describe the type of measurement. Use UNCL 6313 subset.

Element.Name: Measure
Element.Description: For the measure. Use UN/ECE Recommendation 20 and 21.subset.

Element.Name: Minimum temperature
Element.Description: Used to specify the minimal temperature for the transport handling unit under the transport.

Element.Name: Attribute identifier
Element.Description: To describe the type of messure that in this context is the minimal temperature.

Element.Name: Measure
Element.Description: The value of the minimal temperature measurement.

Element.Name: Maximum temperature
Element.Description: Used to specify the maximum temperature for the transport handling unit under the transport.

Element.Name: Attribute identifier
Element.Description: To describe the type of messure that in this context is the maximal temperature.

Element.Name: Measure
Element.Description: The value of the maximum temperature measurement.

Element.Name: Goods item
Element.Description: A Goods item contained in the transport handling unit.

Element.Name: Description
Element.Description: A textual descript this goods item.
Element.Value: Torsk sl u/h fersk fulliset 20kg iso 2-4 kg

Element.Name: Hazardous risk indicator
Element.Description: An indication that the transported goods item is subject to an international regulation concerning the carriage of dangerous goods (true) or not (false).

Element.Name: Item
Element.Description: Description of the product beeing transported. Used for a structurel description of an item. Mandatory if the goods item is a Hazardous items.

Element.Name: Name
Element.Description: The name of the Item.

Element.Name: Commodity classification
Element.Description: To classify when an item number is not sufficient.

Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier.

Element.Name: Hazardous Item
Element.Description: Description of hazardous item.

Element.Name: UNDGCode
Element.Description: The UN code for this kind of hazardous item.

Element.Name: UNDGCode
Element.Description: The UN code for this kind of hazardous item.
The net weight for the item. Use if the Hazard class ID requires it

Attribute.Name: Latitude degrees unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the latitude degrees.

Element.Name: Shipment stage
Element.Description: The shipment stage for this Waybill.

Element.Name: Transport mode code
Element.Description: A code signifying the method of transport used for this shipment stage.

Element.Name: Transport means
Element.Description: The means of transport used in this shipment stage.

Element.Name: Air transport
Element.Description: An aircraft used in this shipment stage.

Element.Name: Air transport identifier
Element.Description: An identifer for a specific aircraft.

Element.Name: Road transport
Element.Description: Description of a truck or a vehicle transporting the goods. Use only if Transport mode code is set to road transport

Element.Name: License plate identifier transport
Element.Description: The licence plate(s) identifying the vehicle seperated by semicolon if there are more than one

Element.Name: Rail transport
Element.Description: Equipment used for rail transport in this shipment stage.

Element.Name: Train identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the train used as the means of transport.

Element.Name: Rail car identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the rail car on the train used as the means of transport..

Element.Name: Maritime transport
Element.Description: Description of a truck or a vehicle transporting the goods. Use only if TransportModeCode is set to maritime transport.

Element.Name: Vessel identifier
Element.Description: The registred identifier of the vessel

Element.Name: Delivery tracking identifier
Element.Description: Used to provide a tracking id for delvivery e.g. UPS or postal.

Element.Name: Delivery location
Element.Description: The location where the goods are delivered.

Element.Name: Identity of the delivery location
Element.Description: Identifies the delivery location.

Element.Name: Name of the delivery location
Element.Description: The name of the delivery location.

Element.Name: Address of the delivery location
Element.Description: The address of the delivery location.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Location coordinate
Element.Description: To specify the coordinates.

Element.Name: Coordinate system code
Element.Description: Always "EPSG:3857" by definition.

Element.Name: Latitude degrees
Element.Description: The X coordinate. Use degrees with decimals.

Attribute.Name: Latitude degrees unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the latitude degrees.

Element.Name: Longitude degrees
Element.Description: The Y coordinate. Use degrees with decimals.

Attribute.Name: Longitude degrees unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the longitude degrees.

Element.Name: Estimated delivery period
Element.Description: The estimated delivery period.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The start date for the delivery period.

Element.Name: Period start time
Element.Description: The start time for the delivery period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The end date for the delivery period.

Element.Name: Period end time
Element.Description: The end time for the delivery period.

Element.Name: Despatch address
Element.Description: The Despatch Address is the address from where the goods is despatched.

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the location from which the goods and services are despatched. For example a global location number.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number for the despatch address.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Location coordinate
Element.Description: To specify the coordinates.

Element.Name: Coordinate system code
Element.Description: Always "EPSG:3857" by definition.

Element.Name: Latitude degrees
Element.Description: The X coordinate. Use degrees with decimals.

Attribute.Name: Latitude degrees unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the latitude degrees.

Element.Name: Longitude degrees
Element.Description: The Y coordinate. Use degrees with decimals.

Attribute.Name: Longitude degrees unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the longitude degrees.

Element.Name: Altitude
Element.Description: The Z coordinate.

Attribute.Name: Altitude unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to altitude.

Element.Name: Estimated despatch period
Element.Description: The estimated despatch period.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The start date for the delivery period.

Element.Name: Period start time
Element.Description: The start time for the despatch period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The end date for the despatch period.

Element.Name: Period end time
Element.Description: The end time for the despatch period.

Element.Name: Delivery terms
Element.Description: The conditions agreed upon between a seller and a buyer with regard to the delivery of goods and/or services (e.g., CIF, FOB, or EXW from the INCOTERMS Terms of Delivery).

Element.Name: Delivery terms identification
Element.Description: Delivery terms code (Inco terms).

Element.Name: Special terms
Element.Description: Special delivery terms that exceeds the inco terms.

Element.Name: Delivery terms location
Element.Description: Delivery terms location. The location to which the delivery terms refer. Used to qualify the delivery terms e.g. "Terms of delivery are FOB Rotterdam"

Element.Name: Additional document reference
Element.Description: Reference to documents relevant for this Waybill.

Element.Name: Identity of the reference
Element.Description: The reference number of added document

Element.Name: Document type code
Element.Description: The type of reference. Must me part of UNCL1001

Element.Name: Document type
Element.Description: The type of reference that cannot be specified by a code

Element.Name: Attachment
Element.Description: Group to describe an attached document. An attachment can refer to an external document or be included with the document being exchanged.

Element.Name: Embedded binary object
Element.Description: The referenced document can here be inserted as a binary object.

Element.Name: External reference
Element.Description: A reference to an attached document that is external to the document(s) being exchanged.

Element.Name: Address to internet resource
Element.Description: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the external object as an Internet resource.

Element.Name: Signature
Element.Description: A signature applied to this Waybill.

Element.Name: Identifier Signature
Element.Description: The Id of the Signature.
The date upon which this signature was verified. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD".
The local time at which this signature was verified.. Format = "hh:mm:ss".

Element.Name: Signature party
Element.Description: The party signing this Waybill.

Element.Name: Consignee party name
Element.Description: The name of the Signature party.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: The postal address of the Signature Party

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country
Element.Description: The country for the address

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Person
Element.Description: The person who applies the signature on behalf of the Signature Party.

Element.Name: Person ID
Element.Description: The ID for a person. The type of ID can be specified in a schemeID.

Element.Name: First Name
Element.Description: The persons first name.

Element.Name: Family Name
Element.Description: The persons family name.

Element.Name: Job title
Element.Description: The persons job title.

Element.Name: Attachment
Element.Description: The actual signature included or refered to as an attachment .

Element.Name: Embedded binary object
Element.Description: The referenced document can here be inserted as a binary object.

Element.Name: External reference
Element.Description: A reference to an attached document that is external to the document(s) being exchanged.

Element.Name: Address to internet resource
Element.Description: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the external object as an Internet resource.
